Description: Fragment of wall of Attic black-figured pottery krater. Inside glazed; outside, part of upper body of figure in mantle, draped over the left arm, red stripe below, facing left; to his right, part of a warrior, probably facing left, shield with running leg blazon in white, traces of spear and Corinthian helmet above, leg below; red dots round the shield rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p. 50 pl. 166.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1052)
